docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: BENNY CARTER arrived in New York from California last Wednesday to start a week of rehearsals for the retrospective concert he will play with the American Jazz Orchestra tomorrow evening at 8 in the Great Hall of Cooper Union. The concert is part of a continuing celebration of his 80th birthday, which falls on Aug.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MORAL fervor dominated ''Pan-American Festival II'' at the Emanu-El Midtown Y on Sunday night. One in a series of dance concerts bearing the overall title of ''Out of the Blue,'' the program featured two choreographic protests against oppression.

docs.snippet: LEAD: As celebrations marking last year's peaceful ouster of President Ferdinand E. Marcos began today, the two men who led the revolt met stiffly at a military cemetery, their relations strained and their reputations dimmed....

docs.snippet: LEAD: IN ''Duet for One'' Julie Andrews plays Stephanie Anderson, a virtuoso concert violinist whose brilliant career and seemingly successful marriage are both cut off when she contracts multiple sclerosis. The role is a milestone in Ms. Andrews'...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IN ''Duet for One'' Julie Andrews plays Stephanie Anderson, a virtuoso concert violinist whose brilliant career and seemingly successful marriage are both cut off when she contracts multiple sclerosis. The role is a milestone in Ms. Andrews's career for many reasons - it is one of the most emotionally demanding and dramatic parts she has played and it exposed her to the suffering of a group of people she came to respect and admire.
